result.execSummary:
The defendant Alysha J. HAMMOND was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Prescription Drug (Naproxen), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(9)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Court finds defendant's will benefit and society will not be harmed by expungment of record pursuant to Section 973.015 of the Wisconsin Statutes upon successful completion of sentence.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Two (2) months, up front under the Huber Law.  
Two (2) months stayed, to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
No agreement.   Status conference set for 09-22-15 at 2:00 p.m.   
Minutes.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 08-06-15 at 10:00 a.m.

Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 06-04-15 at 3:30 p.m.  Plea date is set for 08-06-15 at 10:00 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing is reset to 041-6-15 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives her statutory time limits within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 04-14-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that she have no contact with Kyle Porodish.  Bail furnished.
